parameters.description: Network interface to get bandwidth usage from. eth0 and eth1 are your first and second nic respectively. If unsure use the public, private, and all values. Overages are billed on public traffic.

parameters.description: Interval of data in seconds. Historical data is condensed, if provided value is smaller than existing steps for the date range the endpoint will return data with the smallest available step.

tags.name: Bare Metal Devices
tags.description: Endpoints to handle bare metal devices.

tags.name: Device
tags.description: Access to your Bare-Metal or Virtual Devices

tags.name: Ignition
tags.description: Endpoints to manage CoreOS ignition files.

tags.name: Network
tags.description: Endpoints to perform network related tasks

tags.name: Deployment
tags.description: Endpoints to handle your servers provisioning

tags.name: Webhook
tags.description: Access and modify your Hivelocity webhooks.

metadata.description: Returns metadata about the query including the 95th percentile values of the returned data, legend for returned data arrays, and query args passed to the query.

bandwidthData.description: Returns an array where each item contains a dictionary of data and an identifier for each requested interface. The data itself is an array of arrays where each item is the measurementat the requested `step` and the index of each integer value corresponds with the legend returned in the `metadata`.

interface.description: The interface(s) displayed in the image.

switchId.description: The unique ID of the switch where bandwidth data is measured.

graphImage.description: A PNG image of bandwidth usage.

interface.description: The interface(s) displayed in the image.

switchId.description: The unique ID of the switch where bandwidth data is measured.

bondingSupport.description: If true, ensures the provisioned device supports port bonding. If false, ensures no bonding support.

osName.description: The name of the Operating System to provision on this device. Must match name of an operating system product option.

hostname.description: A FQDN for the device. For example: `example.hivelocity.net`

ignitionId.description: The unique ID of an Ignition File for FlatcarOS provisions.

productId.description: The unique ID of the desired product to provision.

forceDeviceId.description: For users with reserved devices. The unique ID of the target device to provision.

customIPXEScriptURL.description: URL to download custom iPXE script if not supplying script in entirety

script.description: A Cloud-Init script or a post-install script (Bash for Linux or Powershell for Windows).

customIPXEScriptContents.description: Contents of iPXE script if not supplying URL

osName.description: The name of the operating system currently installed on this device. Note: If you manually reload your own OS over IPMI this value may not reflect the OS currently on your device.

orderId.description: The unique ID of the order for this device.

hostname.description: The user specified hostname for the device. Note: If the hostname is changed in the portal or on the device itself this value may not reflect the actual hostname on the device.

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this device.

productId.description: The unique ID of the product associated with this device.

serviceId.description: The unique ID of the service associated with this device.

primaryIp.description: The first assigned public IP for accessing this device.

deviceId.description: The unique ID of the device.

customIPXEScriptURL.description: URL of custom iPXE script used to provision device

script.description: The post-install/cloud-init script used during this device's last provisioning.

customIPXEScriptContents.description: Contents of custom iPXE used to provision device

forceReload.description: Whether to force a reload even if fields have not changed

osName.description: The name of the Operating System to provision on this device. Must match name of an operating system product option.

hostname.description: A FQDN for the device. For example: `example.hivelocity.net`

ignitionId.description: The unique ID of an Ignition File for FlatcarOS provisions.

customIPXEScriptURL.description: URL to download custom iPXE script if not specifying contents in entirety. If both script URL and contents are not specified, the last iPXE script contents are used if OS selection requires an  iPXE script.

script.description: A Cloud-Init script or a post-install script (Bash for Linux or Powershell for Windows).

customIPXEScriptContents.description: Contents of iPXE script if not specifying URL. If both script URL and contents are not specified, the last iPXE script contents are used if OS selection requires an iPXE script.

orderGroupId.description: Unique ID to identify the group order.
Unique ID of the group order.

deviceId.description: The unique ID of the device.

deviceType.description: Generic description of device. Usually type and rack unit size.

hasCancellation.description: True if device has active cancellation request.

isManaged.description: True if device enrolled in managed services.

hostname.description: a fqdn for the device. for example: `example.hivelocity.net`.

ipmiEnabled.description: True if device is accessible over IPMI by customer.

displayedTags.description: List containing key/values of device info based on tag order.

tags.description: List of all user set device tags.

location.description: Detailed information on the device location.

primaryIp.description: The first assigned public IP for accessing this device.

ipmiAddress.description: IP address for IPMI connection. Requires you to whitelist your current IP or be on IPMI VPN.

billingInfo.description: If set, detailed info on this device's billing method. Otherwise null. When null the accounts default billing info is used for payments.

servicePlan.description: The unique ID of the associated service.

lastInvoiceId.description: The unique ID of the last invoice for this device.

hostname.description: A FQDN for the device. For example: `example.hivelocity.net`.

tags.description: List of user set device tags.

thresholds.description: Alert thresholds for IPMI sensor values.
Alert thresholds for IPMI sensor values.

deviceId.description: The IPMI ID of the device.

host.description: IP for IPMI access. Requires your current IP to be whitelisted or the IPMI VPN.

lockerUrl.description: Link to encrypted locker containing password for initial ssh access. Locker contents be expired from api 7 days after initial provision.

passwordReturnsUntil.description: Date password will expire from API.

password.description: Password for initial ssh access. Will expire from api 7 days after initial provision.

version.description: IP version of this assignment (ipv4 or ipv6)

clientId.description: Unique ID of the assignment owner

firstUsableIp.description: First address available for use by Devices on this subnet.

lastUsableIp.description: Last address available for use by Devices on this subnet.

usableIps.description: A list of usable IP addresses on assignment. It is only filled for IPv4 subnets.

deviceId.description: The device receiving traffic from the assignment.

portId.description: The port receiving traffic from the assignment.

vlanId.description: The VLAN receiving traffic from the assignment.

nextHopIp.description: Next Hop IP address, if this assignment is statically routed.

portId.description: The unique ID of the port.

ipAssignments.description: IP Assignments IDs currently routed to this port.

nativeVlanId.description: The unique ID of the port's native vlan, if applicable. Send value `0` to remove the native vlan from this port.

nativeVlanTag.description: The vlan tag of the port's native vlan, if applicable.

type.description: Indicates if is a bond interface. If not, indicates the Mbps rate of the port.

nativeVlanId.description: The unique ID of the native VLAN, if applicable.

deviceId.description: The unique ID of the port's device.

portId.description: The unique ID of the port.

result.description: Success|Pending|Failed. Null value also means Pending.

taskUpdated.description: Timestamp of most recent activity taken on the network task. This will update multiple times for multi-step tasks.

clientId.description: Unique ID of the client triggering the task.

metaData.description: Key value arguments used to trigger the task.

taskId.description: Unique ID of the network task.

deviceId.description: Unique ID of the target device.

triennial_location_premium.description: Additional triennial fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

hourly_location_premium.description: Additional hourly fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

product_id.description: The unique ID of this product.

product_bandwidth.description: Human readable networking specs in the format: Free Outbound Transfer / NIC Size

monthly_location_premium.description: Additional monthly fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

product_name.description: The unique name of this product.

product_original_price.description: Retail price of product. Use with `product_on_sale`.

annually_location_premium.description: Additional annual fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

product_drive.description: Human readable drive specs. Can include multiple drives.

semi_annually_location_premium.description: Additional semi-annual fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

product_cpu_cores.description: Human readable CPU core and thread info in HTML format.

processor_info.description: JSON CPU info for cores, threads, sockets, and vCPUs.

product_disabled_billing_periods.description: Orders for the periods in the array will fail. Possible values: hourly|monthly|quarterly|semi-annually|biennial|triennial

biennial_location_premium.description: Additional biennial fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

quarterly_location_premium.description: Additional quarterly fee for this `product_id` in this `data_center`.

location.description: JSON city info: city, state, & country.

purpose.description: List the intended use of each IP in the subnet. Required by ICANN.

nextHopIp.description: Route traffic from the IPs in the assignment to this IPv4 or IPv6 IP.

expressions.description: Used with `tags` to determine option compatibility. See product docs.

tags.description: Used with `expressions` to determine option compatibility. See product docs.

id.description: Unique ID of the option. Stays the same across products.

customIPXEScriptContents.description: Contents of iPXE script if not supplying URL

ignitionIds.description: Specify Ignition file ID for CoreOS/Flatcar provisions

customIPXEScriptURL.description: URL to download custom iPXE script if not supplying script in entirety

forceDeviceIds.description: Either deploy these Device IDs or fail

publicSshKeyId.description: ID of SSH Key to use for deployment

typeCode.description: The service type code. The list of service types can be accessed on https://core.hivelocity.net/api/v2/service/types .
The service type code. The list of service types can be accessed on https://core.hivelocity.net/api/v2/service/types .

name.description: The name of the service type

code.description: The unique Code of the service type

facilityCode.description: The Facility where the VLAN will be created, for example: `NYC1`. Only Devices from the same Facility are allowed in the VLANs.

type.description: Choose `public` if you want to be able to assign IPs to the VLAN, making it reachable from the internet. Choose `private` if the VLAN should never be reachable from the internet. All VLANs are subject to traffic billing and overages, with the exception of private VLAN traffic on unbonded Devices.

automated.description: If true, VLAN can be automated via API. If false, contact support to enable automation.

qInQ.description: If true, VLAN is configured in Q-in-Q Mode. Automation is not currently supported on Q-in-Q VLANs.

portIds.description: Unique IDs of ports or bonds.

vlanTag.description: The VLAN Tag id from the switch. Use this value when configuring your OS interfaces to use the VLAN.

type.description: If `public`, this VLAN can have IPs assigned to become reachable from the internet. If `private`, this VLAN can not have IPs assigned and will never be reachabled from the internet. All VLANs are subject to traffic billing and overages, with the exception of private VLAN traffic on unbonded Devices.

portIds.description: Unique IDs of ports or bonds.

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask
